captions.text: What the fuck he doin'?

What the fuck is that?
Hey, come here.

- You told me she took
the kids in the other car.
- She did, boss.

She did evey fuckin' day.
l don't know what's goin' on.

Hey, no fuckin' way.
Hey, no fuckin' way. That's it!
This fuckin' guy.
Fuckyou, you fuckin' vulture.

Two little kids in the car.
This is so fuckin' bad.
This is so fuckin' bad.
l see 'em, all right?
t see 'em!
Shut the fuck up, okay?

You don't have the guts to look 'em
in the eye when you kill 'em.

You gotta hide
with that fuckin' shit.

[ Chi Chi ] Tony, he's getting up.
Come on. let's do it.
Makeyou feel good, huh?

Makeyou feel good to kill a mother
and her kids. Makeyou feel big.

Like you big man!
Well, fuck you!

What doyou think l am?
You think l kill two kids and a woman?

Fuck that!
l don't need that shit in my life!

- You die, motherfucker!
- [ Groans ]
[ Horns Honking ]

Whatyou think l am? Whatyou think,
l a fuckin' worm, likeyou?

l toldyou, man!
l toldyou, don't fuck with me!
l told you, no fuckin' kids!

No, butyou wouldn't listen!
Well, you stupid fuck! Look atyou now.

comments.author: Nicholette Casey (Nikki)

comments.text:
+fizman22

"Tony never patted himself on the back."

This kind of self-congratulating to convince one's self that what they're 
doing isn't so bad happens internally. If it happens externally, they're a 
narcissist.
comments.author: Elijah Jones

comments.text:
+Elijah Jones Tony never patted himself on the back. He knew he was scum 
which is why he didn't want his sister dealing with his kind.

Also you can carefully notice that Tony wasn't happy about killing the 
politician either, which led to that drunken stupor in the restaurant. 

The man was innocent after all and did him no wrong, business is business 
though. Innocent women and children is where he drew the line though. 

In this regard he kind of reminds me of Omar Little from the Wire, who also 
never harmed anyone not involved in the drug trade. He just lacks his other 
admirable qualities.
comments.author: fizman22

comments.text:
+fizman22 So far. We don't know how much worse Tony would have become.

Plus, that "code" is just a way for him to pat himself on the back while 
engaged in a really underhanded and shady business.
comments.author: Elijah Jones

comments.text:
+Elijah Jones Tony simply had a code, where as Sosa clearly doesn't. Think 
about it, Tony never killed anyone that wasn't directly involved in the 
drug trade.
comments.author: fizman22

comments.text:
+Elijah Jones Do you think Tony would've allowed that guy to kill the woman 
and two kids if he knew that Sosa will kill him inevitably?? I think not, 
he would not have been able to live with himself. Having died to save the 
innocent wife and kids is still the better outcome than being allowed to 
live his forever-haunted life by Sosa.

his downfall. Should he could have children, then the story would go on 
with his offspring continuing the business, namely a son.﻿

comments.text:
The point of these scenes in mob stories is to show the fucked up morales 
of gangsters. They don't have a problem with injuring or killing thousands, 
selling drugs that ruin countless lives or abusing their family members but 
they have a moral code like not killing women and kids. The same thing in 
the Sopranos with Tony and animals. Having no problem killing people or 
abusing his family but being sad over an animal dying. It's too show that 
these people are flawed, not that they should be idolized. ﻿
comments.author: revbertbetbn
